div1.p:
Your letter some time since arived at hand in a few days after It was written I should have written before this but I have intended starting up ever since I arived Never mor than a weak a head but know it has become my duty to stay untill 3d Monday. In february I find my motherinlaw involved in matters her for her son E P. Stewart he is at present gon to New Orleans to try and make money enough to pay what debts she is bound for on his account. I am still trying to extricate her from some other buisness she is involved in I have some money to raise here on my own account about $175. after which I will be up and see you to remain some few weaks I want to bring my family up only one child, our oldest we lost in Texas, we called this one for sister Jane. Jane Gillespie Brown, she favours the Browns very much. Mrs. Frazier has bin very sick in fact we did not expect her to live for two weeks She is now
the mend slowly. I am quite anxious to get off I heard from brother John a few days ago he was then in New Orleans had found some vacant land in the Attuckapas Country that he is entering, I suppose he will move there, you may look for us about the last of February. we are only tolerable with bad colds —
